document.title: Georgiaâ€™s K-12 Standards for English Language Arts (SY2025-2026)

A7581D474FAB48A7943CA54E85F781B3.description: With adult support, explore various sources of information, including print, digital, and personal communication. (I)

5691C455A67245EB88B5BDD58CC04DC4.description: With adult support, refer to parts of texts when supporting an idea, answer, or opinion. (I)

69CE1370D0A04E68BBC0F73C93FEEF45.description: Curating Sources & Evidence Reference parts of texts to address a specific topic or question and explore various sources of information to make connections across a broad range of topics.

5944C0093D0B479E97448436461C5476.description: With adult support, share relevant and accurate information through a variety of different modes. (C)

9B794EDF9BCA4E32940B3A478D2DFE86.description: With adult support, collaborate to conduct research on a shared topic of interest by gathering and organizing information from provided sources (including print, digital, and personal communication) using graphic organizers or other support aids. (I)

84664875C12A498AB1CFAB9119CA01F7.description: With adult support, ask questions about topics of interest for research. (I)

C9BA51376EA4407BA70F7FB219F1AB6D.description: Research & Inquiry Build knowledge about the world by asking or generating questions about topics of interest, researching the answers, using multiple sources, and communicating relevant and accurate information about the topic.

5FF5AE5DF7CF4043A6C96841BA2583A7.description: Research & Analysis Students use, discuss, analyze, and curate texts as they engage in various conversations, activities, and projects about a range of grade-level texts and topics.

A0EEE1A8F73C4B9A9EC6381177806D73.description: With adult support, use poetic techniques to create poems that may or may not rhyme. (C)

2D26D6B480214B8988BAF8C00E001EEF.description: Identify poetic techniques used to craft poetic texts, including rhyme. (I)

B3A99BD208904686968B72986CB3A136.description: Poetic Techniques Identify and use poetic techniques to shape understanding.

4DCF6E95118F4A828FF2154565D46941.description: Use a combination of drawing, labeling, writing, and dictating* to express an opinion about a topic. (C)

CFBCADB2796743C1AE8154C27508F82F.description: Explain the difference between opinions and facts about a topic. (I)

3C556DAD4D1D43948469B8E33087F17C.description: Opinion Techniques Identify and use opinion techniques to shape understanding.

D02A025B22C647D4A8CF0BB1AD91C1FD.description: Use a combination of drawing, labeling, writing, and dictating* to create a text with expository techniques that includes a topic and information about the topic. (C)

ADBDE768A93A46E5AB71B8FB85191838.description: With adult support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text. (I)

E07F05E48328465485FD6CD4DE7176FD.description: Identify techniques used to craft expository texts, including main topic. (I)

892231A01B164207905F93EA3F53B625.description: Expository Techniques Identify and use expository techniques to shape understanding.

3AE5D57B4FA747E9B0C390969E077436.description: Use a combination of drawing, labeling, writing, and dictating* to create a text with narrative techniques (e.g., characters, setting, events) told in the order in which they occurred. (C)

08F1458C38C34CDE91FADD2877334F6C.description: With adult support, compare and contrast characters and their experiences in stories across diverse cultures. (I)

2BB46ECF1E6B461199A659BBA5C19846.description: With adult support, demonstrate an understanding of the central message, lesson, or moral of the story based on the words and actions of the main characters. (I)

6053C24F8FBD4913B53943CD11DD9BB2.description: Identify techniques used to craft stories, including characters, setting, and major events. (I)

44A9F5EA501F4AEC83667E946040A039.description: Narrative Techniques Identify and use narrative techniques to shape understanding.

A621F957ABCD478FBFAA22DA4B8FDBED.description: Techniques Students identify and use narrative, expository, opinion, and poetic techniques as they interpret and construct a variety of texts.

2FAC487543074A9296E654F5D4C80850.description: With adult support, use interesting and/or descriptive words to craft engaging texts. (C)

1C274A5E413A40008C8343F9704A6640.description: Identify interesting and/or descriptive words that express feelings or appeal to the senses in texts. (I)

F20D1CD22D8E469E93672E57594FBDEC.description: Craft Identify and use descriptive and engaging language.

B3B1B7E077164967A60A5C5D32D41E0D.description: With adult support, retell events and actions in sequence. (C)

82838B845DA24E049846B615B448628F.description: With adult support, use text features, including titles, illustrations, and/or labels, to add clarity/coherence to texts. (C)

C12014D2B5E24F4ABBAF12A5D9EA5DFF.description: Identify and use text features, including titles, headings, photos, and illustrations, to determine if a text is fiction or nonfiction. (I)

644FC8A1600445A99047AB4B341DA200.description: Organization Identify and use organizational structures to craft meaning.

E8706855E0234E80A3EB74A613D421EE.description: Structure & Style Students build and apply knowledge about language and organizational structures and elements used to convey and arrange ideas and information in texts.

77CEB0943B574C668C237822F2C13A70.description: Identify the authors and illustrators of picture books and explain their roles. (I)

8EA508D94CDB46E0835B5AC18D178026.description: Authors & Speakers Investigate the relationships between authors and speakers in texts.

E6F8A06706C449CF820C664DC3EE5330.description: With adult support, create texts in various modes (e.g., print, digital, auditory, and/or visual). (C)

90A70D36DE6C4E8F8575D6EE701ADF92.description: With adult support, identify different modes of communication: print, digital, auditory, and visual. (I)

C33A397493C14A2AB9389ADD4C52B347.description: Identify the general purpose (e.g., to tell stories, to provide information, to share opinions) and target audience in a variety of texts. (I)

D0608DD6CE7447BCA32EE4C893479488.description: Purpose & Audience Explain how authors of texts use language for a specific purpose and a target audience.

B00E8CF7058B4C73AF1AB84D50BC56F7.description: Context Students explore the relationships and roles of authors, purposes, and audiences of texts.

E20489C3EEFE4190BB5278613142EED6.description: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.

54AAA7F27F53459C9E41E25A7653E4D8.description: Use knowledge of word relationships and learned vocabulary words and phrases when making word choices in speaking and writing. (C)

9D87BCE047AE44DF89732A3112412851.description: Identify and sort common words into basic categories based on similarities and differences. (I)

73D38D4E673241719D7106245AE6B341.description: With adult support, determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases. (I)

E7135BD8B9914BF6A7B21D646B5A92D6.description: Meaning & Purpose Make connections between words and phrases and use reference materials to determine or clarify word meanings in a variety of settings and for a variety of purposes.

D61635DEBEB44C4AAF2D5E58C2E49F4E.description: Word Analysis Acquire and apply word analysis skills to deconstruct and construct words to make meaning.

AD632BC8EDA3444E950703898E766758.description: Use grade-level general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases to communicate in a variety of settings. (C)

761CB47DB9CB4860B0B969DF01307303.description: Acquire general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases through grade-level texts and content. (I)

8624D7302B9B48849B97BE0EE601C382.description: General, Academic, & Specialized Vocabulary Acquire and use general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases in a variety of settings.

5BC7DB124E35409DB3078D318C42BDA4.description: Vocabulary Students engage in a wide range of written and spoken activities during which they expand and deepen their vocabularies, build word analysis skillsets (morphology), and determine or clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

71A5E5B68F964A448D949E39C78DC2BC.description: With adult support, use singular and plural subjects with matching verbs. (C)

A78A6F07DDF7435EB2F8B625841AE820.description: With adult support, use simple sentences to express complete thoughts in written texts. (C)

538D7B638D5E489890E7761BFA547D29.description: Recognize that conventional sentences always include a subject and a predicate. (I)

2D0F7A52A1EE4B6194F7847AC8B72E65.description: Syntax Recognize and compose coherent sentences that express complete thoughts.

C998B283E8E6456081B961B907EE4929.description: Mechanics: Use periods, exclamation marks, and question marks at the end of sentences. (Introduce)

7DC84F42444D40B795B766F4E71E304F.description: Usage: Use determiners (articles, possessive determiners, demonstrative adjectives). (Introduce)

E33D0BB2ED764F86B27E4865ABF193F5.description: Grammar: Form and use the simple verb tenses. (Introduce)

6794A8EBC0B2438FA817FB378532E014.description: Grammar: Use common and proper nouns. (Introduce)

C875BF205FFD436C9CC85D176D80BAC3.description: Grammar: Form and use verbs by adding -ing, -ed, or -s. (Introduce)

F7D3C0EA02CE480691BC992F49133529.description: Grammar: Form regular plural nouns by adding -s or -es. (Introduce)

5B9BF6A2D4124943A09FA52847124F72.description: Mechanics: Capitalize the first word of a sentence and the pronoun I. (Introduce, Master)

559D20956B484FCC84E6DAC956FF2B3F.description: Usage: Use interrogatives to ask questions when speaking. (Introduce, Master)

3CCCDB7C5BF94D9CA8145CD9DCFAD458.description: Usage: Form and use singular and plural nouns when speaking. (Introduce, Master)

F1C60291159E4D639928F8CA463D0D14.description: Usage: Use nouns and verbs to share complete thoughts when speaking. (Introduce, Master)

641569BB85294C9E88E0D2C0384CFAF1.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics Learn and apply conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to aid the comprehension of texts and to communicate clearly in written and spoken language.

BA555E86B4F045168B6B22B9D88835FB.description: Grammar Conventions Students observe, analyze, and use the structures and conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics as they interpret and construct texts.

8706D60C2B4D4CC592F5764ADFCE08C4.description: Language (L) Students learn and apply the structures and conventions of standard English. Students observe and analyze how grammar works in reading and writing. Students build vocabularies and determine word meanings as they relate to reading and writing.

1C5FEDD3A5C341D1A131E81AD296F1D9.description: Build background knowledge by reciting all or part of significant poems and speeches as appropriate by grade level. (I/C)

71F5E77AD7A340D99D4432D5E74C6793.description: Engage in dialogue with audiences by asking and answering questions. (I/C)

12BDCDAE4AEF49DEB7126543AFF18010.description: Vary tone, pace, and nonverbal gestures as appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

D94AE026457C4D8E90B08360C9694EF2.description: Integrate modes and genres most appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

572DBF53D4014884BCF79147B8C4F28C.description: Communicate clearly to present ideas, information, and texts. (I/C)

71C7FAACC85F499CA8150986F4AB4D8A.description: Presentation Use presentation skills to tailor communication to target audiences for specific purposes.

16DF902202724D8EA3C8FCD1E6D469EA.description: Work with others to discuss topics, investigate questions, solve problems, and explore and create texts. (I/C)

E0C37E6F22484078B8138939A42F6EA8.description: Contribute to discussions and shared projects by offering ideas, listening to the ideas of others, and providing feedback. (I/C)

12D2AC210A1643548B837DD481C8874B.description: Collaborate with others to determine group norms, establish goals and procedures, and facilitate productivity when working on shared projects. (I/C)

B938F326A5DD4D1D85A212D2400771D9.description: Arrive to group discussions and collaborative meetings prepared to be an active participant in the work. (I/C)

428E8CF2E15F443A8938F5467D3CCD23.description: Collaboration Collaborate with others to accomplish shared goals and projects.

86F344FE18E04F40BBA046D8ED88BC8D.description: Collaboration & Presentation Students build and share knowledge as they engage with others in a range of settings and for a variety of purposes.

C9CC959884CE47EC8DCD55E769AC7C03.description: Consume and produce multimodal texts, integrating a variety of genres, text features, and craft techniques to influence target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

C75BF2D8B0B04EF98E58E128A6F2BF23.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact how ideas and information are structured and arranged in texts. (I/C)

B3DFF4B55EB34617AB61E8D8A466B130.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact what kinds of ideas and information are included in texts. (I/C)

D572DF46826F45AB8164F3E7BCE1096F.description: Explore and create texts in various modes and genres, developing and applying knowledge of how specific features impact meaning, tone, style, purpose, and audience. (I/C)

707BC6572C5642FB996395FFB6CB0DF9.description: Text Design Consider the impact of text design on audience and purpose when consuming and producing texts across modes and genres.

02A36BEC0A4A4C65A643ADA5F9280CFC.description: Organize texts by incorporating specific formats, structures, patterns, and features to influence the audience, facilitate accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

5736C16E917B4A83A41F7C6FB9E9E2A9.description: Make decisions about sentence structure and syntax in order to accommodate and influence the audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

2A75F6537C8E4A1391BB3EEE6E59379F.description: Craft words and phrases in order to influence the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions of the target audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

57EAEC815C494ACFAE732EECF0C39088.description: Integrate literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements to appeal to target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

A47E240425754D188EF20E826CB55543.description: Writing like a Reader Construct texts with the audienceâ€™s experience in mind, basing decisions about craft techniques on context and purpose.

E0AB1DB480E9423A9E49EBBBCB824090.description: Describe, analyze, and evaluate the design and organization of the text, explaining how specific formats, structures, patterns, and features influence the audience, contribute to the textâ€™s accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

B77BE274187E4768B306AE79E50AB525.description: Explain, analyze, and evaluate how the authorâ€™s use of sentence structure and syntax affects the target audience and supports the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

174C36264CB44152ABA768C6AA98953A.description: Identify, apply, and analyze important, interesting, or effective uses of language, explaining or evaluating how specific word choices affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

707BD64C41F74D3FAFFEF570967B6AA7.description: Identify, apply, and analyze the literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements in texts, explaining or evaluating how specific elements affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

3D363595BEFB418F88C4D1AA0936547A.description: Reading like a Writer Interpret texts through the authorâ€™s lens by identifying, analyzing, and evaluating craft techniques that are connected to the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions triggered by the text.

64DE9F4BEA904B82931AB9D953A315DC.description: Authorâ€™s Craft Students apply knowledge of authorâ€™s craft to enhance the interpretation and construction of texts.

FF57D30A7AB943B49026CAF40163B53A.description: Draw from knowledge of how authors consider context and audience to determine which information and ideas to highlight, which text design is most accessible, which word choices and language structures are most effective, and which craft techniques are most impactful. (I/C)

3D46A52D5C7143E490C46761E32501A0.description: Draw from knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish a clear point of view or unique perspective when interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

0A237A10F86545B6BC3D27D83AC8503B.description: Develop and apply knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish the purpose of texts being interpreted or constructed and to evaluate the extent to which those texts achieve those purposes. (I/C)

E5131512A2BF470791EB14C41AE77868.description: Author, Audience, & Purpose Interpret and construct texts by developing and applying knowledge of the strategies and techniques authors use to accommodate the target audience and achieve the textâ€™s purpose.

314EF104836549509E69F1696B852AB2.description: Explore how context shapes the authorâ€™s decisions and the audienceâ€™s responses during the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

5DD63839C92E4C30B9ED6D3DB3139A15.description: Consider how context impacts the purposes of the author and the audience. (I/C)

3B8435B7D60D42B49A9C4C9CD27EB9ED.description: Use prior knowledge, formal or informal research, and discussions with others to identify the key components of context that are most relevant. (I/C)

E6C0874D816D4207A7D1F91DBD2BC380.description: Context Develop and apply knowledge of key components of context such as background information, geographic location, cultural influences, time period, and contemporary events when interpreting and constructing texts.

99F0451BF79443B286504B0A94C2365A.description: Situating Texts Students develop and apply a multilayered understanding of context, author, audience, and purpose to ground and propel the interpretation and construction of texts.

B90826AEBFB04B83B59C9E1CE5788B50.description: Edit the text, ensuring it adheres to the conventions of written language. (C)

7CE393A835C248BEA6042D3D4CBEDD39.description: Make changes to the text based on self-evaluation or external feedback, revising the organization, ideas, information, word choices, and craft techniques in order to increase the textâ€™s effectiveness. (C)

3B7FD29AB5AD43C59C380460C2ACA5B2.description: Evaluate the textâ€™s effectiveness based on self-review or feedback from others, determining whether the text matches the purpose and goals for writing. (C)

3D77CDF053E9451299E505473FE1A36B.description: Construct an initial draft by integrating ideas and information; selecting words, phrases, and sentences; and incorporating craft techniques that will best achieve the purpose of the text and resonate with the target audience. (C)

5B965471E6B94B68B66212BDB18F13A9.description: Link ideas and information to the organization plan, highlighting ideas and information that are most relevant, useful, and impactful. (C)

ECB570B4602E42ADBA371D63EFA8F28B.description: Generate ideas for content by assessing prior knowledge, gathering information from texts, and engaging in discussions with others. (C)

2058808F5B3544A5899487FAA7676063.description: Plan how to organize the text by selecting modes, genres, and structures that will achieve the purpose and meet the needs of the target audience. (C)

E514A1F6B4754C36913B7752CB6A28F9.description: Establish a purpose and goals for writing and identify a target audience. (C)

ADBF54099F6E47A5888E42DFCBB34DD8.description: Writing Processes Compose a range of texts for a variety of purposes and audiences, flexibly engaging in writing processes to plan, draft, evaluate, revise, and edit texts.

EC5EE5D1A4E146E6AB9E6091BF4C8918.description: Determine the meanings of unfamiliar words and concepts by applying knowledge of context and of academic vocabulary and word parts. (I)

25433BFDA6CB4B0EB4648308F8213F69.description: Make, track, and support inferences about different levels of meaning within the text. (I)

14111B9083FA4F2EA2DBF34CE01E7C68.description: Make and track predictions about the events and information likely to come next. (I)

9A4DF538B12F4373A77E9FB1F83B29CD.description: Summarize and visualize sections of the text to maintain understanding. (I)

9BE68366674841C5A7284FC043356AF8.description: Draw from, compare, build, and integrate prior knowledge with the material in the text, addressing inconsistencies or gaps and adding to knowledge repertoires as appropriate. (I)

7AB5794E38B94A5D8AEF29F2AB9670F7.description: Scan and skim the text, making note of structures and sections that might be most useful. (I)

0A4D5567F11E4ED2B5AC00921EADC597.description: Establish a purpose and set goals for reading, monitor comprehension, and adjust as needed. (I)

5A9EBA6068534C5BBBA5FBA27ECA8C0C.description: Comprehension Strategies Engage with a range of complex texts for a variety of tasks and purposes, accessing and using strategies for comprehension* before, during, and after reading as part of the meaning-making process.

BEEB9AD6C9A74D8B9C4704334C8CF711.description: Consume and produce texts in order to solve problems or influence decisions. (I/C)

F0CA24C5C1964154909BAF72FAC4DB26.description: Interpret and construct texts to aid the analysis and evaluation of texts and ideas. (I/C)

A81525FA42A041A6AF1FB0DB3037F69D.description: Explain and learn concepts and processes by interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

43BEC9674E974B368CD79FABFFCEF6B7.description: Make use of texts to build knowledge, develop skills, make informed decisions, and share information and ideas. (I/C)

6BE287C405CC4381A111AE72F23D9FB4.description: Share real or imagined experiences by interpreting and constructing texts that tell or include stories. (I/C)

29D396888A284B52BD42F9A82CEE327E.description: Engagement & Intention Engage in written or spoken dialogue as author and audience for a variety of tasks and purposes, making intentional connections within, between, and beyond texts.

449D423F0A3B4C34969269A806DE1F1F.description: Develop independence and autonomy as a reader and writer. (I/C)

628F7CE491D5494DA275A3F12D8E1D06.description: Participate in a community of readers and writers by developing group norms, discussing texts, sharing individual writing, listening as others share their writing, and offering and responding to feedback. (I/C)

4376448A4FE845FE8CB36DC667D19706.description: Build a repertoire of comprehension and composition skills, strategies, and techniques, drawing from them as needed to aid the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

E387DBD511A64E17A5975EFCB58931A2.description: Select, read, and write texts of personal interest and academic relevance to grade-level texts and topics. (I/C)

249FAC346CFA4301A16966DCC9BE32BB.description: Discuss or write about personal and academic reading and writing preferences, referring to specific techniques, topics, modes, and genres that resonate most. (I/C)

7633DA4D91E34AEFA95EA2AAE1C78BCE.description: Generate, understand, monitor, and discuss personal and academic reading and writing goals, revising as appropriate. (I/C)

A0437D8BF6B245E5891E9F56DE40AF50.description: Reader & Writer Identity Build an identity as a reader and writer, developing a repertoire of resources and tools to continuously expand participation as an active consumer and producer of texts.

BF826C10B70644A2BFEB3DF94A2BA0AD.description: Engagement & Intention for Comprehension & Composition Students develop personal and academic identities as readers and writers, approaching texts for a variety of tasks and purposes and engaging in reading and writing processes in order to deepen comprehension and strengthen composition.

0C032D6BC128404A9067DFC98B3EE81C.description: Practices (P) Students engage routinely in four literacy practices that ground, shape, and inform the expectations of the Foundations, Language, and Texts domains.

83373BD6D2984AACBFED81CA05450F24.description: Write Cursive This progression begins in 3rd grade.

741A82A969804ADC878C761BD860D5F5.description: Read Cursive This progression begins in 3rd grade.

979D06CB198B4121B50C8F2F0C5EF69E.description: Begin building handwriting fluency by forming accurate letters, including those in first and last names.

BDA533C6820544C291425BF551C34F71.description: Transcription & Handwriting Fluency Use working memory skills to transcribe oral language to written text and maintain meaning while writing letters, words, and sentences quickly and accurately.

5F6419C17C77453FB596391C70CED078.description: Use appropriate spacing between letters, words, and sentences.

E8D086D3FD924B6EBC4E8C7D14D014DC.description: Form words, including first and last names.

268F1A63E25C43EE9CED889AE326E6C6.description: Form all uppercase and lowercase letters.

922327EEBBDC44EAB7EF6B79CD71430F.description: Motor Skills & Letter/Word Formation Use fine motor skills to form legible letters and words in print.

4B28B7EE041E4D77905B93E27DC05E4F.description: Handwriting Students develop print handwriting skills.

83F0762ABE1F429ABC4F5F8CAEA0A399.description: Read grade-level texts with purpose and understanding.

0C8C5517BA554FD991E52B88D4925443.description: Read familiar texts chorally with appropriate volume and rate.

144ABAE32C954E8C9DA53667638225BC.description: Develop sight word vocabulary using decoding skills by reading regularly and irregularly spelled high-frequency words in isolation and context with increasing automaticity, including first and last names of students and others.

00EC879DBEC742D69703F0075DC5325B.description: Oral & Silent Reading Fluency Demonstrate oral and silent reading fluency while reading texts for understanding, self-correcting as necessary to ensure accuracy and aid comprehension.

EB8C9C69972C473AA0512121441C559A.description: Fluency Students read text aloud or silently with speed, accuracy, and expression.

D8405AFD017C4E999A380D3497FBFF9E.description: Decoding & Encoding with Phonics This progression begins in 3rd grade.

BC42A1C3A0E143C9A8445487A77FAEB1.description: Identify and encode irregularly spelled high- frequency words.

EF358508444E46BA9291C8422807A048.description: Use knowledge of letter/sound correspondences to connect letters (graphemes) to sounds (phonemes) to encode simple one-syllable words, including high-frequency words (VC, CV, CVC). â€‹

48C196C5D5F440A9A066D8B899831165.description: Encoding with Phonics Use grade-level phonics skills to encode words in context and in isolation.

730C927293AB425FAB98FF5E995F99C6.description: Identify and distinguish between words that are spelled similarly by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

2B57613CB7CE4B14800A2FD9BDD3E9FC.description: Identify and decode parts of irregularly spelled high-frequency words.

0486BB51124848539168ECB2D9C43F91.description: Blend letter sounds to decode simple one-syllable words, including regularly spelled high-frequency words (VC, CV, CVC).

B947D1F2A2824A5EB915684C3D4789AE.description: Decoding with Phonics Use grade-level phonics skills to decode words in context and in isolation.

087C41A9436744228007F5412047269C.description: Identify and produce both long and short vowel sounds for A, E, I, O, U.

AB6FA9D95DB34A638AE364829035708B.description: Identify and produce basic one-to-one phoneme-grapheme correspondences for the most frequently used sound for each consonant.

E0A836959FEE463697D67D31C95BAE20.description: Phoneme-Grapheme Correspondences Identify and produce phoneme-grapheme correspondences.

75CBC35110E847DEB1F2E758DC32F07B.description: Phonics Students learn the relationships between the sounds of spoken language and the letters of written language as they decode and encode words in context and in isolation.

70032DF0B67E44AC9222754009C8238D.description: Name and identify each uppercase and lowercase letter in random order.

E007B92706834809BD3B0C2165847EB8.description: Recite the letters of the alphabet in order.

A42409C8D8DF4BFB9DB04DC6A4AFF7DA.description: Alphabet Knowledge Demonstrate knowledge of the alphabet.

2AF040AE9C4D426683A8762BEB631FB8.description: Understand that sentences begin with capital letters and end with punctuation to indicate the end of a sentence.

D7518D90640241C8A6A314388D5D422A.description: Recognize that words are separated by spaces.

BAF7E8772E1C4298984EE2B3F2467805.description: Recognize that written words are made up of individual letters.

E474B41E02334939866ECE688C6B8697.description: Mechanics of Print Texts Build a knowledge base of print conventions.

F0168E4732B24AA6AD5589F3239EBA26.description: Identify the front and back covers of books and their basic elements: titles, author names, illustrator names, and graphics.

309E20C159B44F5ABEC7ED3A98983120.description: Follow text from top to bottom, left to right, and turn pages from right to left.

216E53A423094400B0922A57E0A4C998.description: Hold books upright and begin reading at the front.

9956FB6ACBD94E7680C0F01520D73FBA.description: Book Orientation & Directionality of Print Texts Understand the conventional layout of books and how to maneuver them.

AB08CE01778E4529935717EAF954F3B0.description: Distinguish between letters, words, digits, and graphics.

D22BE10C13044DAA9E7C5E9A23B50615.description: Recognize and interpret print messages in the environment, such as labels and signs.

B26B82695A164C2C9AD3BED79D37318F.description: Recognize that texts and images represent objects and ideas, have meaning, and convey messages.

1974C085597F40E7A864181D586AC2B6.description: Conceptualizing Text Understand that texts communicate messages.

1D2DF24C9F9E471E8AF1818F6EDB64F7.description: Concepts of Print Students develop the awareness that written language carries meaning and that certain features of print ensure that texts are understood.

E88EC5F6C35647C9B2607225F3D1F4E0.description: Add, delete, and substitute phonemes in spoken one-syllable words with up to three phonemes.

6A26C377502342EAB7641C886E0CECB2.description: Blend, count, and segment up to three phonemes in spoken one-syllable words.

17E56CB102C847C481DEDF86390E2C5F.description: Identify short and long vowel sounds in spoken one-syllable words.

E28498510F9540AD959C3A398910BF62.description: Isolate and pronounce initial, final, and then medial sounds in spoken words with three phonemes.

6135F99A39CC4B93B49044C23F013A25.description: Phonemic Awareness Identify and manipulate the individual sounds in spoken words.

59AC4CF047754C7788A122F1A3975066.description: Segment onsets and rimes of spoken one-syllable words.

847D3F865E6D4E93B17C67D770A66C62.description: Blend onsets and rimes of spoken one-syllable words.

09127E755DA4469FAAEC80D142446351.description: Onsets & Rimes Blend and segment onsets and rimes in spoken words.

2CA46CD403704927886B0E6457C8854A.description: Blend and segment syllables in spoken words.

E1B3D9768B5740E0B6209F00A3731A00.description: Count and pronounce syllables in single and multisyllabic spoken words.

9D36FD89F5834BBD876FFBBFD3F2A8AE.description: Know that syllables are word parts with one vowel sound.

95948671B68B4D42B3096D1105EB1B92.description: Syllables Identify and manipulate syllables in spoken words.

72172BBC09924C2C9362A63F6EB6DFE5.description: Add, delete, and substitute single words in spoken compound words.

D7115B4190184B38B3713BD2E0CC5AF5.description: Blend and segment separate words in spoken compound words.

CFF66284A7DA49FA91957494EFD88222.description: Compound Words Identify and manipulate separate words in compound words.

298FD740CC2347249719B75AE05D635C.description: Know that sounds are put together to make words and that words have distinct meanings. â€‹

8FE9CA5FFE8C444FA3E54C02DB8EF3EA.description: Segment phrases and sentences into words.

863440B45045446AA41BBA1C71F690DC.description: Know words are put together to make sentences, and sentences communicate complete thoughts.

1A176CE6AE214711A95645EFA2B67D4B.description: Words & Sentences Recognize the basic relationships that exist between words and sentences.

D7F73A5823C643869219422187EC9683.description: Identify and pair words that rhyme in spoken language, distinguishing them from those that do not.

5E483FF14E1C44C3B05F63835D72B359.description: Rhyme Identify and produce rhyme in spoken language and oral texts.

DC8B7FD849AF4ED782C80196AB5E9746.description: Phonological Awareness Students develop the ability to identify and produce the sound structures of spoken language and how they can be divided into smaller components and manipulated.

3397624E1C8D456887174000BFD3A41F.description: Foundations (F) Students build a foundation for achieving dynamic literacy practices to aid reading comprehension.
